number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 19, 2014
												As Sonic and Sega All-Stars second outing into the Kart racing arena, Sumo Digital have modified the formulae through introducing transforming vehicles.With a larger roster of playable characters from some of the companies most beloved franchises and corresponding courses, hectic split-screen and online competition ensues.Some of Sonic's 3D adventures have not quite reached terminal velocity, but with the help of the Sega stable, does his kart caper steal the limelight from a certain Italian plumber. Featuring a breadth of single and multiplayer modes. The World Tour mode acts as an introduction to both the game mechanics and further game modes. These include time attack, battle race, traffic attack and boost races with inventive timed challenges. Each lap features dynamic tracks with land, sea and air obstacles. The players vehicle teraforms accordingly within each zone requiring a unique strategy to control the vehicle. With multiple routes through each course, it pays to experiment and fine tune your approach. A key tactic is maintaining a 'boost' via boosting pads and rings, landing a series of tricks or drifting. Its easily achieved with the brake input and long sharp turns can be mastered to achieve a level 3 boost.As you progress through the tour you unlock up to 3 medals per event based on your difficulty chose, which are then used to unlock new events and characters. The game also features a traditional Grand Prix, with playlists of all the races found in the world tour. The game revives a wealth of characters from throughout Sega's history, re-imagining them in slick, new HD forms. There's also plenty of fan service in the form of the fantastically inventive tracks and items that are all uniquely helpful, whilst never becoming unfair game changers. The mechanic of transforming throughout a race works extremely well, forcing the player to adapt their play style completely. Whilst giving accurate feedback and control from the sky and waves, rather than being a mere automated aesthetic change.Although racing is a well polished mechanic and revisited throughout the various modes – it is easily re-playable both on your own and with others. Furthermore the invention of boost races and traffic attacks are entertaining but also serve to test and improve your specific abilities in boosting and navigating a course. The game can be both very accessible and challenging, but these are fair frustrations which ultimately make you a better player.With over 25 playable characters, there are a range of vehicles with different perks to conquer different challenges. Although there are none to detest some are licensed characters making an unusual appearance.Each character can also level up with races earning them modifiers to improve or balance each attribute of their vehicle. Rather than being a player license level it requires each character to be levelled up, ultimately for the same items and begins to feel like an RPG grind.Sega have raided their treasure troves to craft a balance kart racer, that makes innovative strides in the genre. Not only does it look great and play well, but it reinstates some of its greatest veterans in reminiscent worlds.Sumo Digital have refined the kart racing genre in their offering whilst introducing a more dynamic take of plane and boat racing with sophisticated environmental physics. The game manages to capture what was great and good about Sega whilst becoming an exceptional addition to their roster. Perhaps Sonic is faster behind the wheel.Watch at: 


YouTube™ Video: Sonic & All Stars Racing Transformed - PC // Review 

			Views: 469		

			Some of Sonic's 3D adventures have not quite reached terminal velocity, but with the help of the Sega stable, does his kart caper steal the limelight from a certain Italian plumber.

content:

												Yes, Mario Kart clones come and go but Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed (phew!) stands above the rest.SASRT has flying (not gliding) sections, boating (not underwater) and car racing.  The characters aren't as memorable if you're not a huge Sega afficionado but seeing some of these locations can only make a Nintendo fan pine for a Nintendo All-Stars Racing game.The best thing about this game is that the tracks change per lap.  One lap you'll be driving and the next lap the course may get blown up, causing you to fly!  It keeps every lap entertaining as you wait to see what happens next.  The items don't afect you as much as in Mario Kart so when you get hit, you don't get as frustrated.The only negatives?  There is no Crazy Taxi course and the game CAN be a little glitchy.  Definitely worth a try if you're getting tired of your new Mario Kart game but want something new.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 1, 2016
												Quick factsGood+ Solid port that runs well on many systems and looks good (tip downscale from 4k for better results if your hardware can handle it).+ Customize the stats of your driver to your liking with mods that you unlock just playing as them.+ Responsive controls that reward drifts and air tricks accordingly.+ Good soundtrack with tunes from some of Sega best games.+ Dificulty options for new players and experienced kart game players.+ Multiplayer local play with special mention to the option of the possibility to play the entire campaign cooperatively.+ Online multiplayer modes for up to 10 players per event.* Full Xbox 360 controller support with rumble.Bad- A little barren online community (nowadays)- Some bugs here and there (mostly in the track physics)- Generic items and some derivative courses.- Some form of balance issues.- Ommision of some other good franchises from Sega.One of the best "karting" games that exists on PC, and one of the select few that give the Mario Kart series a run for it´s money. The gameplay mechanics reward skill and dedication, even giving the players the options to choose his real favorite character and choosing determined stat presets to set it at their preferred style. The method of controlling your vehicle is a little loose, and the physics act a little wacky from time to time, something that can bother the way up to the podium in the S class difficulty. Also, the online mode doesn´t get many players nowadays, so it´s more likely you end playing only with your friendsGood variation of tracks from classic jewels from Sega like Panzer Dragoon or Burning Rangers, and   the soundtrack sports some great tunes from After Burner, Shinobi and more. Not as stellar as the soundtrack, the item selection is one of the most boring i have seen in a game, but well it´s not THAT broken, like the infamous Mario Kart blue shell. The game is well suited for new and veteran players alike, and more enjoyable with a controller. Solid choice for playing in local mode with splitscreen for up to 4 players.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 23, 2015
												I picked up Sonic & All-Stars Racing: Transformed (SASRT) during the 2015 Steam Summer Sales almost at random out of boredom, thinking it probably was the poor man's Mario Kart.  Boy was I absolutely wrong.  Far from being a cheap knockoff,  SASRT proved to be an alternative of equal quality, sometimes even improving Mario Kart's formula when it comes to presentation (the game is surprisingly good looking with a smooth frame rate) and variety (well designed transforming tracks and vehicles have vastly different gameplay depending whether you're driving a kart, a boat or a plane).Furthermore, regardless of how much I absolutely loved Mario Kart 8 on Wii U, I cannot help but think that SASRT is just the superior game from my point of view: it's prettier (an easy 1080p, 60fps even on modest PC hardware), simultaneously more technical and fun to play (the game rewards skill and the randomness of items isn't as frustrating), with a much better solo campaign and varied challenges (the World Tour mode which includes, Ring Races, Boost Challenges, Boost Races, Drift Challenges etc..), complemented by a stellar soundtrack for fans of old school SEGA games (remixes of Golden Axe's Wilderness, Shinobi's Itaden and Japonesque, and Panzer Dragoon's Flight brought back childhood memories), and wrapped up by an absolutely whacky roster of misfits (Football Manager, Willemus and Danica Patrick.. serioiusly ? WTF ?! ).  What's not to like ?In closing I can only highly recommend SASRT to everyone, Steam Summer Sale price or not, most particularly to old school SEGA games nostalgic and Mario Kart fans.  It's the most fun I've had in a while and gets my absolute praise.  Bravo !

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 6, 2015
A great kart racing gameIt plays great. You feel a sense of speed and performing drifts and tricks is fun. I have a feeling that some of the people that worked on this game also worked on F-Zero GX. Compared to Mario Kart Wii, the cars control better. (I haven't played Mario Kart 8.)But it has some flaws. The menu has an very annoying announcer, the power-ups aren't that good and the music is not memorable. And although I did say it plays great, the physics can be weird sometimes and the track design questionable. Sometimes a small mistake can mean coming to a full stop and finishing the race close to last.This game can be hard. But in my opinion, that's what makes it great. And to add variety, you also race by airplane and by boat, with the tracks often transforming themselves, It will keep you on your toes.People will instinctively compare this game to Mario Kart. But it's closer to F-Zero and Diddy Kong Racing in terms of gameplay. And that's OK with me.If you're looking for a kart racing game to add to your Steam collection, this is the one.

content:

												At first I thought this was a crappy mario kart ripoff, but I found I was wrong.This game takes the best aspects form mario kart and adds sonic characters and some breath-taking levels.Seriously, these are some of the best levels Ive ever seen in a videogame, the vibes, effects, colors, everything just pops.Make sure you play this at max settings.My only complaint is the flying levels, flying is really awkward, not extremely difficult, but it changes the pace of the race in a bad way. Its also difficult to hit opponents, turn, and its easy to get stuck on various objects.Other than that imagine mario kart 8 on steam with sonic rather than mario.Also they add people from all of segas games, not just sonic. So its more like SSMB x MarioKart.Pretty good, great for local gameplay as well.

content:
Posted: December 21, 2015
												Well, this is just stupidly fun. Annoyingly I originally played this game using a keyboard (UGHHH) as I didn't have a controller at the time. Only AFTER finishing most of the game did I manage to get hold of an XBOX360 controller. Luckily there is still a large amount to complete which I wouldn't have been able to without the controllerGetting a controller is a must. The drifts are loads of fun and very easy to pull off (my 3 year old can do it) which is great when you don't want to put too much thought into your gameplay. Love the unlockable characters, to see Team Fortress in there was a pleasent surprise. Graphics wise the game oozes neon and bright colours which adds to the childish fun of it all. Transforming instantly into a boat/car/plane is such a great nod to ones childhood, where you would be playing with a toy car which of course could hop off the couch and onto the floor (sea) where it could take off and fly around the room. Too much fun. Highly recommended.

The game is well suited for new and veteran players alike, and more enjoyable with a controller. Solid choice for playing in local mode with splitscreen for up to 4 players.

content:
Posted: December 6, 2015
A great kart racing gameIt plays great. You feel a sense of speed and performing drifts and tricks is fun. I have a feeling that some of the people that worked on this game also worked on F-Zero GX. Compared to Mario Kart Wii, the cars control better. (I haven't played Mario Kart 8.)But it has some flaws. The menu has an very annoying announcer, the power-ups aren't that good and the music is not memorable. And although I did say it plays great, the physics can be weird sometimes and the track design questionable. Sometimes a small mistake can mean coming to a full stop and finishing the race close to last.This game can be hard. But in my opinion, that's what makes it great. And to add variety, you also race by airplane and by boat, with the tracks often transforming themselves, It will keep you on your toes.People will instinctively compare this game to Mario Kart. But it's closer to F-Zero and Diddy Kong Racing in terms of gameplay. And that's OK with me.If you're looking for a kart racing game to add to your Steam collection, this is the one.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 5, 2015
												Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed for PC is the perfect alternative to Mario Kart of a fun and whacky racing party game, if you don't own a Nintendo console.As a racing game it doesn't have the deepest mechanics, but drifting, braking and reward for skill are all there, so there's nothing to dislike. As a racing party game, it has tons of content! Customization, varied characters, stages and fun powerups... everything you want to have fun with your friends. Online play and a lot of singleplayer content make it a good singleplayer experience.It's graphics are not super great though, but they do the job. It's music is a good selection although it isn't the catchiest. The selection of characters and stages though are kind of... ackward. Ignoring the fact that Wreck-It Ralph, Danica Patrick and Team Fortress are even in this game, the selection of characters from SEGA titles in the end seem weird and don't work all that well together. In comparision to Smash Bros. where all characters fit really well together, this game as a wide and weird array of characters that don't really match. Still, the ammount of SEGA representation is here including Amigo, NiGHTS and tons of Sonic characters, as you'd expect.The system of the track changing and the cars trasforming to planes and boats really is the mechanic that makes this game really stand out. Each vehicle has different yet similar mechanics making it so it's easy and simple for the player to change control schemes, while still making it varied. That being said, perhaps it's a little too similar since the tracks are always the same and the vehicles transform in select sections make it so that it really blends in to the game too much, making this unique mechanic not stand out as much. What I mean is that the tracks don't really take too much advantage of the three forms and doesn't unlock its true potential. You don't have a option most of the time to choose if you take a shortcut for the car or a vertical shorcut with the plane. It's always the same and there isn't too much freedom to transform. Still, it's a pretty neat mechanic and is worth checking out on its own.Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed is perfect if you want a racing party game but you don't own a Nintendo console and it's worth checking out even on its own. It's a fun game for sure, but it's not groundbreaking and is not a real replacement to other party games since it's a PC game.Worth checking out.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 9, 2016
												This is a worthy successor of Sonic & Sega All-Stars Racing. It improves on it and is currently the best competitor for Mario Kart. It may be a little inferior to the Nintendo kart racing, but it's still an awesome game for this genre. Plus, Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed isn't a Nintendo exclusive. Like the title implies, this time around you race in 3 vehicle types: car, boat and plane. And you'll frequently change between these vehicles during the same race. The car plays almost the same as the original title, which focuses on gaining extra speed through drifting and boosting. The car is stable and easy to control. You can also drift and boost on boats and planes, but the boat sections are more focused on hitting ramps to perform stunts to earn boosts and the plane sections are more focused on hitting boost panels in a more straight line, while also evading the course obstacles to get extra boosts. The boat is harder to maneuver because of the water waves and because it's harder to turn. The plane is more straightforward, with the added verticality to control. But sometimes it can be a little stiff, especially during sharp turns. But overall, the vehicle switch mechanic is fluid and the physics are great for all of them. The carrer mode is essentially the same as the previous title. World tour to me felt like the original mission mode, but more organized with added unlockables. Gran prix is just that, a series of 4 races awarding points in each race based on the final position. But this time you can't restart in the middle of it, and that's how it should be to me. Time trials are the same, but this time with added leaderboards. And of course, there's single race. The game is also way harder than the original, and the expert difficulty is hard, with some events being very hard, like some of the time trial ghosts. But it's doable with some practice, and as you play and experiment you'll get better. There's also online mode, which isn't quite dead yet, but i didn't spent much time on it. The character and track selection is also better than the original. While some characters were removed, there's plenty of new ones. Some are from the same game as others, some from other SEGA titles, some 3rd party ones (e.g. Team Fortress), and even a real life rally racer that here drives a Hot-Wheels on land. This selection feels better and more diverse, even with the removed characters. The tracks are also cooler. There's only 16 tracks (not counting 4 returning ones), but they are more diverse, longer and change mid-race, so the 3 laps aren't always the same. Added with the vehicle switch and good design for the most part, these tracks are a blast to play on. They are also beautiful as well as the graphics, a real eye candy. The soundtrack is also cool. This time the tracks are arrangements instead of ripped songs, and they work pretty well (i love the Golden Axe arrangement on Adder's Lair, as well as this course). If you like kart racing games, this is an easy recommendation, even if you think that you may like it. It may take some time for beginners to get good, but it's definitely worth it.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 5, 2014
												This is one of the best kart racers I've ever played.   I'm not a huge kart racing game fan, but I've played all the classics like Mario Kart 64, Diddy Kong Racing, and Double Dash.  This game is very much like combining all 3 of those games into one big package, while still mixing it up enough to have it's own feel.PROS-30+ Characters-Performance Customization for Karts-Several Gameplay Modes-Online & Local Multiplayer-Cheap DLCCONS-High Difficulty-GrindyGAMEPLAYYou transform your kart on the fly during races by going through transformation parts on the track, but you can also perform tricks that will give you a speed boost during transformations and also during any air time.  Go off a ramp, do a trick, get a boost.  If you fail the trick you will slow down.  Tricks are performed simply by flicking the Right Analog stick on the controller, and depending on the direction you will do different tricks.  Doing a certain trick at a specific moment can make or break your race.  E.G. Do a right flip, to move to the right in mid air so you can avoid a wall or a fall.There are several characters to choose from, each has their own strengths and weaknesses.  Sonic is one of the faster characters, but he has trouble turning while Amy has easy turns and acceleration but is not as fast.  You can also unlock up to 5 (6 total) mods for each character that will change up their stats.  Example, you can get a mod for Sonic that will lower his speed but increase his acceleration and turning.  This way you can play your favorite character on any track as long as you have the mod required for that character best suited for said track.  Mods are unlocked simply by playing your characters and leveling them up.  They earn experience for every race played, including in online matches.  There are lots of characters and this can actually feel like a grind but if you only play 1 or 2 characters it's fairly easy to max their level.  I haven't played very long but I have Sonic and Shadow both at max level.  The DLC characters automatically come at max level with all mods unlocked.There are several tracks to choose from, but most need to be unlocked in the campaign mode.  The campaign mode is a simple follow the path to unlock the next track.  You earn stars for each race you complete, and higher ranking races earn you more stars.  I recommend simply playing the highest rank at all times mostly because those stars are needed to progress.  You need to spend stars to unlock new characters, tracks, and certain mods.OVERALLAll in all, this game is great and if you are a Kart Racing fan you will definately want to pick this one up.  Don't bother getting the console version either since they are no longer supported by the devs.  PC version has more characters, tracks, and extra DLC.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 1, 2015
												Lately it seems that everyone's got their own take on the classic racing game.  Some are no more complex that Pole Position while others claim absolute realism and physics.  The problem is that so many games are either plagued with confusing AI or buggy controls that it ruins the experience.  Others do everything right but constantly have a hand in your wallet for DLC that should have come with the base game.  Sonic isn't that way.  Yes there's some paid DLC but you don't really need it unless you just have to play as your favorite classic gaming icon.  It's an arcade racer and requires a game controller ( Xbox controller) to get the full effect.  You could use the keyboard but that kind of ruins the experience doesn't it.  This game is console port on all counts and suffers all the afflictions that come with it even with the Steam Overlay.For one thing if you want to race against someone in the same room they better be logged into steam and you'll need to be patient as you switch between the game UI and Steam to get them connected.  Nothing is intuitive about it even to a console gamer when you throw the quirks of a PC into the mix.So I must hate it right?  Wrong.Maturity has granted me patience and once the game's quirks were figured out I was having a blast.There's a single player mode that is really just practice.  In it you can unlock new tracks, level and unlock new characters and earn achievements.The tracks themselves are whimsical and as gorgeous as any arcade racer you'be seen with a myriad of racing challenges that include not only the ability to battle your firends with powerups you collect along the way but also race cars, boats planes and spaceships.It's a great casual racer with gorgeous visuals and hours or replayability.  Everything a racer isn't in most racers these days.

content:
Posted: July 28, 2014
												If you thought your gaming life was not complete until you raced against Shogun from 'Shogun Total War' as the manager of 'Football Manager' then look no further.  This game is basically identical to mario kart 7 aka mario kart 3ds where the vehicle converts to a plane during the stage, although in mario kart there is no boat per-se, you just drive underwater (seems weird now by comparison).  The boating part is really cool, but maybe I'm a little biased for boats.  The racing mechanics change when the vehicle transforms into those types, so you have to change your racing style to accomidate.  That gets kind of hectic when you're trying to maintain 1st place or rise to 1st, not frustrating but challenging.  Ever hear of a game called Uncle Wiggily? It's similar, in that you can be in last place and rise to first suddenly with a stroke of luck by using the powerups.  There's nothing here so frustrating as Mario's blue shell, though, and I was able to hold 1st place most of the time with good racing strategy.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 11, 2013
												Without a doubt the best racer of it's kind available for the PC. To call it a “Mario Kart Clone” is not really fair. It no doubt takes a lot of inspiration from Nintendo's kart racer, but it brings plenty of innovation to the table and makes for (arguably) a slightly more skilled contest with a little but less reliance on luck (though, of course luck still definitely plays its part). The tracks look fantastic and over each lap they slowly change allowing your kart to transform into a boat or aircraft when needed. Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed is a huge improvement over it's predecessor (which you probably could call a “Mario Kart Clone”). It's fast, fluid & fun. If you're after a fun kart racer (or a fun game in general), I'd highly recommend  Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed.

												This is one of the best kart racers I've ever played.   I'm not a huge kart racing game fan, but I've played all the classics like Mario Kart 64, Diddy Kong Racing, and Double Dash.  This game is very much like combining all 3 of those games into one big package, while still mixing it up enough to have it's own feel.PROS-30+ Characters-Performance Customization for Karts-Several Gameplay Modes-Online & Local Multiplayer-Cheap DLCCONS-High Difficulty-GrindyGAMEPLAYYou transform your kart on the fly during races by going through transformation parts on the track, but you can also perform tricks that will give you a speed boost during transformations and also during any air time.  Go off a ramp, do a trick, get a boost.  If you fail the trick you will slow down.  Tricks are performed simply by flicking the Right Analog stick on the controller, and depending on the direction you will do different tricks.  Doing a certain trick at a specific moment can make or break your race.  E.G. Do a right flip, to move to the right in mid air so you can avoid a wall or a fall.There are several characters to choose from, each has their own strengths and weaknesses.  Sonic is one of the faster characters, but he has trouble turning while Amy has easy turns and acceleration but is not as fast.  You can also unlock up to 5 (6 total) mods for each character that will change up their stats.  Example, you can get a mod for Sonic that will lower his speed but increase his acceleration and turning.  This way you can play your favorite character on any track as long as you have the mod required for that character best suited for said track.  Mods are unlocked simply by playing your characters and leveling them up.  They earn experience for every race played, including in online matches.  There are lots of characters and this can actually feel like a grind but if you only play 1 or 2 characters it's fairly easy to max their level.  I haven't played very long but I have Sonic and Shadow both at max level.  The DLC characters automatically come at max level with all mods unlocked.There are several tracks to choose from, but most need to be unlocked in the campaign mode.  The campaign mode is a simple follow the path to unlock the next track.  You earn stars for each race you complete, and higher ranking races earn you more stars.  I recommend simply playing the highest rank at all times mostly because those stars are needed to progress.  You need to spend stars to unlock new characters, tracks, and certain mods.OVERALLAll in all, this game is great and if you are a Kart Racing fan you will definately want to pick this one up.  Don't bother getting the console version either since they are no longer supported by the devs.  PC version has more characters, tracks, and extra DLC.

content:
Posted: December 6, 2013
												To say this game is a fun arcade kart racer would be the understatement of this gaming generation. Everything in this game is an absolute delight from the music and stages to the myraid of characters represented, my personal favorite being Vyse. The game isn't for the faint of heart however as one progresses to higher difficulties, the challenges, all of which intuitively teach you to become a better racer, become harder than you would expect of any kart racer and even many contemporary games in this generally casualized generation. To learn also that this game was a budget shows that SUMO is able to strech every penny they were given, making this an absolutely pleasant experience. The only complaint I can make about this game is the cast which certainly by any range wouldn't be considered a cast of All-stars with YogsCast, Football Manager, and Total War taking priority over Shenmune, or Vectorman. These complaints are rather minimal however with the news of additional DLC possibly coming that might entail such characters being added.

content:
Posted: December 6, 2013
												Decent graphics, well executed transformation mechanic, and well balanced control system (I recommend playing it with a 360/PS3 controller).  Some of the characters are probably better known in Japan or among otaku/old school Jgamers, but overall there's a diverse, entertaining cast.  And in a first for console racers like this, we get some PC characters--Shogun from Total War, three from Team Fortress (one for each transformation), and a Roman general, also from Total War.  All with appropriately funny phrases.  For this PC gamer, it was a welcome surprise.  The tracks are also well done and stand out from each other--real effort was put into this.Lastly, this game gets very challenging very quickly as you increase the difficulty.  I mean HARD, like you-will-need-to-practice-forever in order to beat the toughest setting, which you can't unlock until 2/3 of the way through the game anyway.  Kudos to the devs for making a game that spans from casual to hardcore.

												Sonic and All-Stars racing transformed, really fun fast paced madness.This game is a fantastic kart racing game, it has really nice cartoony graphics, beautiful level design which is based on various SEGA game's levels and also features elements from other games/universes.The game has a fantastic power-up system, all power-ups are balanced and useful unlike mario kart.There is the usual power-ups you'd expect, dumbfire projectile, homing projectile, "banana" powerup (In this its a puffer fish :D) some cool unique power-ups like a tornado that messes up your controls, and lastly the all star powerup.The allstar powerup is really damn cool, it makes your vehicle become freaking amazing, it is a little bit like the starman powerup from mario but it just feels nicer.The career mode on this game is also really great, it has a variation of races and challanges which is nice because you're not just do the same thing over and over.The online mode on this game works very well (In my experiences anyway) I have never had any issues with connectivity and it feels really smooth.The soundtrack to this game is perfect because most levels use their original music or some remastered version.My only issue with the game is that it isn't great if you just want to pick it up and play it with your mates, you first have to complete the career mode which would take you a few hours, though this often the case with many "party" games.All in all a really well made, fantastic game9/10

content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												This game is good. Suprisingly good. It takes Diddy Kong Racing's multiple vehicle system, combines it with the customability of Mario Kart 7, and throws in all the lovely music and levels you should expect from any Sonic game.You should consider making this your go-to party racing game rather than Mario Kart. The weapons are simple, yet well balanced. The rocket, ice, and blowfish all are nice to shoot forwards and backwards, but each have their own little niche to avoiding or dodging. Even this game's version of the "blue shell" is avoidable, assuming you have the skills to weave around it without hitting something else.This game also has drifiting and tricks, which when mastered add some speed to your character, but will punish you harshly if you screw it up and get greedy (by either drifting too far or adding in one too many flips) There's no snaking here, but mastering the drifts and the flips really helps. The track design is incredible. It lives up to the name, and the track morphs and changes as you go on, making you utilize new stratigies or methods to get to the finish line. Each vehicle style (car, boat, plane) handles exactly the way you'd expect it to, which means any time you mess up, it's always your fault.The characters are great too. Some may have more handling, top speed, acceleration, and so on, but you can fine tune these settings with character mods that you unlock simply through playing that specific character enough. Soon you'll unlock mods that will more drastically change the way the character handles. This way if you're playing online, you'll almost always have the car stats you want, even if someone else picks your usual character.Even the minor things, like the over-excited arcade style announcer, the wide varity of characters, and the track specific music add up to make this a great competator to Mario Kart that beats it hands down in one category: it's on the PC.Tip: Get a gamepad for this game. It's much better with precise acceration and turning, plus the second control stick for flipping makes it much easier than a keyboard.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 1, 2015
												Lately it seems that everyone's got their own take on the classic racing game.  Some are no more complex that Pole Position while others claim absolute realism and physics.  The problem is that so many games are either plagued with confusing AI or buggy controls that it ruins the experience.  Others do everything right but constantly have a hand in your wallet for DLC that should have come with the base game.  Sonic isn't that way.  Yes there's some paid DLC but you don't really need it unless you just have to play as your favorite classic gaming icon.  It's an arcade racer and requires a game controller ( Xbox controller) to get the full effect.  You could use the keyboard but that kind of ruins the experience doesn't it.  This game is console port on all counts and suffers all the afflictions that come with it even with the Steam Overlay.For one thing if you want to race against someone in the same room they better be logged into steam and you'll need to be patient as you switch between the game UI and Steam to get them connected.  Nothing is intuitive about it even to a console gamer when you throw the quirks of a PC into the mix.So I must hate it right?  Wrong.Maturity has granted me patience and once the game's quirks were figured out I was having a blast.There's a single player mode that is really just practice.  In it you can unlock new tracks, level and unlock new characters and earn achievements.The tracks themselves are whimsical and as gorgeous as any arcade racer you'be seen with a myriad of racing challenges that include not only the ability to battle your firends with powerups you collect along the way but also race cars, boats planes and spaceships.It's a great casual racer with gorgeous visuals and hours or replayability.  Everything a racer isn't in most racers these days.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 26, 2013
												This game... is awesome. ._.I really wanted to hate this game.  I waited for it to be cheap.  I even went to the local Wal_mart and played the Wii U version before even considering this version.  The Wii U version was a bit on the watered down side as far as I could tell, but the game went on sale a day later and even had cards.  For $7 or so, I felt it was worth a try if only to get the cards and waste time with my little brother.Then, I played the game.  For starters, the announcer is a bit annoying but really hypes the game up so you always feel excited, even when you shouldn't be.  The character roster is amazing.  I even get Team Fortress 2 and JSRF characters!  Not to mention, I went ahead and bought the Metal Sonic DLC character while it was on sale, and that is now my favorite character in the game.  Half the roster is still locked, but I should be able to unlock characters through world tour mode just by spending the stars I earn from each event.Overall, the game gets a 5/5 from me.  It is the closest thing to Mario Kart you can get without getting Mario Kart. Ha.  Seriously, though, it is a great game with great visuals, great characters and impressively deep gameplay.  There is a low bar to entry that should attract newbie racers, but the veterans can really sink their teeth into this.Now, I know it's not fair to not mention the negatives, so here are a few:1.  Announcer is absurdly annoying.2.  Autosave system scares me with a "progress will be lost" warning every time I exit the game, even if the game isn't going to lose any data.3.  Music is a little lame, and some characters would probably do better without vehicles.  Sonic, for example, can probably run faster than any of these cars move, his own car included, and no character really has any special gameplay mechanic.4.  Some of the early challenges are actually very challenging and may scare away new players.

content:
Posted: August 11, 2013
												Without a doubt the best racer of it's kind available for the PC. To call it a “Mario Kart Clone” is not really fair. It no doubt takes a lot of inspiration from Nintendo's kart racer, but it brings plenty of innovation to the table and makes for (arguably) a slightly more skilled contest with a little but less reliance on luck (though, of course luck still definitely plays its part). The tracks look fantastic and over each lap they slowly change allowing your kart to transform into a boat or aircraft when needed. Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed is a huge improvement over it's predecessor (which you probably could call a “Mario Kart Clone”). It's fast, fluid & fun. If you're after a fun kart racer (or a fun game in general), I'd highly recommend  Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed.

content:
Posted: July 28, 2014
												If you thought your gaming life was not complete until you raced against Shogun from 'Shogun Total War' as the manager of 'Football Manager' then look no further.  This game is basically identical to mario kart 7 aka mario kart 3ds where the vehicle converts to a plane during the stage, although in mario kart there is no boat per-se, you just drive underwater (seems weird now by comparison).  The boating part is really cool, but maybe I'm a little biased for boats.  The racing mechanics change when the vehicle transforms into those types, so you have to change your racing style to accomidate.  That gets kind of hectic when you're trying to maintain 1st place or rise to 1st, not frustrating but challenging.  Ever hear of a game called Uncle Wiggily? It's similar, in that you can be in last place and rise to first suddenly with a stroke of luck by using the powerups.  There's nothing here so frustrating as Mario's blue shell, though, and I was able to hold 1st place most of the time with good racing strategy.

content:
Posted: October 28, 2014
												When I picked this up during a Steam sale I really didn't expect much. However I was pleasantly surprised with SONIC & ALL-STARS RACING TRANSFORMED.This arcade racer is a comfortable blend of Diddy Kong's Racing with classic Mario Kart. The different transformation of vehicles, racecar, boat, and plane, all feel unique yet fun, and the transformations feel seamless.Multiplayer is definitely the best part of the game, but you can still get a lot of enjoyment out of single player. There's a large roster of racers to choose from, and, for the most part, the multiplayer works rather well.The only major complaint I have on the game is its strange hit detection: more noticeable in online multiplayer, weird things happen when you collide with a racer, whether you collided with them intentionally or not. Sometimes I'll fly off the edge of the track or the racer I hit with an item won't lose any speed. It can be frustrating in those moments where a single second might mean the difference in winning or losing.Even so, I've already gotten a lot of mileage out of this racer, and highly recommend that you and your friends pick up SONIC & ALL-STARS RACING TRANSFORMED

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 7, 2013
												I don't know who'd not buy the game. It's amazing. And of course, has Sonic and all of your favorite characters!GENERAL:Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed gives you 3 ways to play; alone, with people from all around the world, and at private party. And there's even more ways to play when you play solo. Giving you alot of hours to play for your amusement!CONTENT:You got 30+ characters in this platform. Yes, 30 characters, including the DLC and the unlockable characters from your favorite titles: Sonic, Super Monkey Ball, and so much more! And you can play with them on over 40 tracks. That's alot of combinations there. And it dosen't stop there, you get 5 gamemodes to play with, the combinations are HUGE here.GAMEPLAY:The gameplay is divine. It's like SEGA learned from it's mistakes from SEGA All Stars Racing ancestor and remade it into a more original creation. It's nothing like Mario Kart at all, where you must get OP items to win. If you play alone, you can progress through the game, collect and upgrade your characters! And some singleplayer portions are difficult. It's mechanics are also great. Don't like playing alone? Play online and show the world what you're made of!WEAKNESSES AND CONCERNS:There are problems with this game though, no matter how good it is. First being is that to win, you have to rely on one mechanic: Powerful boostings at a rapid rate. You'll never have a decent Time Attack record without a powerful character. I.E. Shadow with Dreamcast mod is one of them. But if you're skilled, you shouldn't have alot of problems with that.Another concern about this is the server. Though the community is friendly, the servers you're gonna play in, will never be. As you're mixed with these new guys, and real MLG players, and some of them may have bad connection, causing an unbearable amount of crashing into walls and such. Even MLG players suffer from that.Yet another concern is the aftermath, and I mean what happens now when you beat the game, although I like this game, I, at one point, abandoned it because of how usual it is. But I returned to it in a few months after.One of my worries are also being about the tracks, although there's 42 tracks at most, the other 21 is  just mirrored.Last one is about one of the mechanics: The Casino. Chances are in a race, you could get a crappy thing, but a really good one is actually rare. I.E. The useless Nitro is often, but the best ones, like Titanium Frame or Stunt Nitro is almost impossible.FINAL THOUGHTS:To be honest, I love the game, it has alot of potential. But I wish that the developers could realise it. But then again, they might be working on something that could beat this. You should get it at full price, but if you take the problems seriously, then maybe at 20-40% off. I give it a 8.9/10

content:
Posted: December 6, 2013
												Quick, think of Mario Kart 7! Now replace Hang gliding with Jets and underwater with Boats. Now make it Sega themed. Put it on PC, and you got this game.It's a Mario Kart clone, like most cartoony racers, but it's actually an example of matching, if not surpassing, what it's cloning.Both the Jet and Boat control like you expect, and control well. The action is as fast as your skills allow. To get through the races, you need to master the 3 controls.As for the items, they are much more fair. Most notably, the "get the leader" item. In Mario Kart, there's the infamous Blue Shell. Don't pretend that it doesn't♥♥♥♥♥♥people off. Everyone talks about how the Blue Shell will home in at the leader, and ruin their winning streak. In this game, you have the swarm. A bunch of bees (or wasps, whatever), go in front of the leader. They can either dodge the swarm and keep going, or get hit and possibly lag behind. It can also get other players, but the major thing is, it can never hit the player who sent the swarm, so if they're right behind the leader, they don't screw themselves over. This may seem simple, but it's one example of balance. This makes things more fair.The tracks are truly eye candy and even change as players go through the tracks. Usually by lap 3. the course changes to a new transformation. This helps keeps things fresh within the same course.The characters are what you expect, Sonic and Sega. But the real catcher are characters like Wreck-It Ralph and TF2. The mix of characters in this game are really fun, and you have motivation to get the unlockables like Beat and NiGHTS.If there's anything to say about the AI, is that they will KICK YOUR♥♥♥♥♥ They don't screw around, and if you're not good at racers, you won't 100% this game. But when you start to get good, it's feels nice to feel rewarded with wins against the extremely tough AI.As for online, I don't use it much. But I hear there's lag, but it can be playable.If you're a Sega fan, get it. If you're a racing fan, get it. If you're both, GET IT! Even if it's not PC, get it on Wii U, PS3 (which is what I own), 360, Vita. It's a solid game. Altough I hear the 3DS version isn't the best.

content:
Posted: August 11, 2013
												Without a doubt the best racer of it's kind available for the PC. To call it a “Mario Kart Clone” is not really fair. It no doubt takes a lot of inspiration from Nintendo's kart racer, but it brings plenty of innovation to the table and makes for (arguably) a slightly more skilled contest with a little but less reliance on luck (though, of course luck still definitely plays its part). The tracks look fantastic and over each lap they slowly change allowing your kart to transform into a boat or aircraft when needed. Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed is a huge improvement over it's predecessor (which you probably could call a “Mario Kart Clone”). It's fast, fluid & fun. If you're after a fun kart racer (or a fun game in general), I'd highly recommend  Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 1, 2015
												Lately it seems that everyone's got their own take on the classic racing game.  Some are no more complex that Pole Position while others claim absolute realism and physics.  The problem is that so many games are either plagued with confusing AI or buggy controls that it ruins the experience.  Others do everything right but constantly have a hand in your wallet for DLC that should have come with the base game.  Sonic isn't that way.  Yes there's some paid DLC but you don't really need it unless you just have to play as your favorite classic gaming icon.  It's an arcade racer and requires a game controller ( Xbox controller) to get the full effect.  You could use the keyboard but that kind of ruins the experience doesn't it.  This game is console port on all counts and suffers all the afflictions that come with it even with the Steam Overlay.For one thing if you want to race against someone in the same room they better be logged into steam and you'll need to be patient as you switch between the game UI and Steam to get them connected.  Nothing is intuitive about it even to a console gamer when you throw the quirks of a PC into the mix.So I must hate it right?  Wrong.Maturity has granted me patience and once the game's quirks were figured out I was having a blast.There's a single player mode that is really just practice.  In it you can unlock new tracks, level and unlock new characters and earn achievements.The tracks themselves are whimsical and as gorgeous as any arcade racer you'be seen with a myriad of racing challenges that include not only the ability to battle your firends with powerups you collect along the way but also race cars, boats planes and spaceships.It's a great casual racer with gorgeous visuals and hours or replayability.  Everything a racer isn't in most racers these days.

content:
Posted: August 20, 2015
												Vroom, vroom, here we go! Mario Kart 7!Oops, wrong game and wrong company. Oh hey look, Sonic & SEGA All-Stars Racing Transformed!Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed (or SART for short) is the fourth installment in the Sonic & SEGA All-Stars series, which began with the mini-game based party game "Sega Super Stars". Obviously this game is a sequel to "Sonic and SEGA All-Stars Racing". This game was probably SEGA's response to Mario Kart 7, and they did a pretty good job of copying that game. It has the same 'transforming' concept of Mario Kart 7. In Mario Kart 7, you can turn into a glider, in this game you turn into a plane. In Mario Kart 7, you can turn into a submarine with wheels, in this game you turn into a boat. There are a lot of similarities between this game and Mario Kart 7, but I don't really care. This game does look a lot like a Mario Kart clone, but in all honesty, who gives a crap? This game may look like another Mario Kart clone, but it's a pretty dang good one.The gameplay is what you'd expect from a Mario Kart clone. Here's the entire Mario Kart-clone gameplay concept in a half-nutshell: drift to speed up, be a complete jerk with an overpowered power-up, give someone the Luigi Death Stare, boost like there's no tomorrow, win the race. That's pretty much it, but this game is special though, it's kind of hard to explain what makes this game special, but this game just is.All the characters and tracks are all widespread from different game series that SEGA owns, but in this PC version on Steam you get TF2 as a character, which is pretty cool. The only problem I have the character roster is that HATSUNE MIKU ISIN'T IN THIS GAME!!! WHY SEGA, WHY?!?!?! WE SIGNED THE PETITION BUT YOU WON'T HOLD UP YOUR END OF THE BARGAIN YOU DAMN GREEDY PIGS!!! DXIf you have played the grand prix mode or had to select one of the many cups in some other game mode, you'll notice something. Each prix (or cup) has 4 races, but each prix (or cup) has a pattern, here it is: The first, second, and third race has a track with only two of the three vehicle modes, the fourth race has a track where you transform into all 3 modes. Kind of interesting, huh?  So you only get one or two tracks in an entire cup where you turn into a boat, plane, and car all in the same race.Once you master the game, the AI is very easy to defeat. The AI is smart, but not smart enough. Even the S AI (the hardest AI) is easy once you get the hang of it.The World Tour mode is EXTREMELY demanding, the special mini-game races (or whatever they're called) in the game have you do the craziest of things, like in some parts the game makes you race THROUGH TRAFFIC. The most annoying thing about the racing mini-games during the World Tour mode is the frickin' time limit. So you're telling me I have to do all this crazy crap ON A TIME LIMIT?! Time limits are something that could tick off any gamer, but this game takes time limits WAY too far. Time limits in video games never make any sense, but this one takes the confusion and frustration to a whole new level with its dreadfully short time limits. It might take you forever to complete a special race due to the damn time limit.The time limits are not the only thing that makes this game annoying.  The other difficulty blunder in this game is the Time Attack mode. You know what these are, right? Get the best time than anyone else. Blah, blah, blah. Yeah, sure, but um...Time Attack is kind of.....impossible to beat. The Hard AI for the time attack mode is UNSTOPABLE. I've tried countless times to get S rank on one of the tracks but the damn ghost wins every time. Please, Sumo Studios, let me beat your ghost once, ONCE!!!This game also has multiplayer modes, but I've haven't actually played any of them. SRY DUDEZ! Well, that's about it for this game. I guess I can close this  book on this review and go back to my life. This review is done. DONE, next game, next, next one, NEXT REVIEW PLEASE.6.8/10I have one last thing to say before I end this review. SOMEBODY PLEASE MAKE A MOD TO PUT MIKU IN THE GAME, PLEASE!!!! OR SEGA, MAKE DLC THAT PUTS HER IN THE GAME, PLEASE DUDEZ!!!! Please SEGA, put our beloved Hatsune Miku in this game. Please......... T_T

content:
Posted: July 13, 2014
												Fantastic game for fans of kart racers. It has quite a high learning curve and is deceptively difficult so don't go into this thinking this will be an easy game. Don't let that put you off though as it is very rewarding improving your racing skills. Every vehicle feels different. I tried getting a couple of my friends who are huge Mario Kart fans to play. They liked the feel of the cars but not of the other vehicles due to unfamiliarity. If you're not willing to give the game a chance due to reasons like that then you won't enjoy it. Stick with it though and you will find a beautiful, and enjoyable racing game and the best alternative to Mario Kart that you will find. The netcode has some problems which does lower enjoyment somewhat but the online matches are still the most enjoyable part of the game. Racing against other players is way more fun than racing the computer. Dare I say that if the game was more polished it may have even taken the Mario Kart crown! Highly recommended!

content:
Posted: January 16, 2015
												A very fun racing game, the graphics are fantastic and the maps are really well designed, heres why.You do the first lap, short and simple.The second lap changes, a route might be blocked by a monster or something.The final lap goes ape sh*t.I have never seen this in any racing game before, well I kinda saw this in Spongebob Squarepants and the creature from the Krusty Krab, but the races feel staged and are very easy.However the game does have a downside, and that's with it's keyboard controls....Now before I tell what I think of the controls, nearly everyone is fully aware that Keyboards are better at shooting games rather then driving, however after some practice you can become very well.Now usually it's WASD to control the car or move the mouse to where you want to go, but here, SHIFT of all keys is to accelerate! Why shift? Why not the W key, plus to move it's the arrow keys. Again, why not WASD? I'm used to Saint's Row and GTA's driving controls and they are much better, why change it so SHIFT is accelerate and the arrow keys are turning? At least your hands are wide apart for room, but I would perfered WASD to this.Overall this game is fantastic, controls are strange at first, but it's a very fun game.Also playing as the Spy from TF2 in a plane is the greatist thing ever! OH NO!

content:
Posted: December 31, 2015
												If you like Mario Karts, but don't like the hassle of finding your wii controllers, and LOVE the idea of playing multiplayer with your friends on your very own screen, then this is the game for you.One thing I will say, is that it does not like weird monitor resolutions; I have a 27" UltraWide monitor (2560x1080) and you won't even get to the menu, so I have to run the game in a more "traditional" resolution, but that's fine by me.On a positive note, my biggest problem with MK was that I never really knew where to go, but this game not only has MUCH larger indicators of upcoming turns but it also has brightly lit power-ups so you can see them ahead of time and plan your route accordingly.The inability to skip after-race-stats annoys me (I've been known to break things over inescapable cut-scenes) but I still had a blast with my daughter playing.So, plug in your spare 360 controller, load up and invite a friend. :)

content:
Posted: August 16, 2016
												I gave this game an unfair shake when I first played it as I thought it controlled weird and I didn't care for a fair amount of the characters and the ones I do care about didn't make the cut (Ristar, Streets of Rage characters, Alien Storm characters etc) but I went back again recently and I apologise for dismissing it so quickly.This game is really damn good, better than some Mario Karts I would say. It has more than enough to hold you over regarding single player content. There's your typical grand prix cups and single races but you also have an "adventure" mode where you do different challenges to unlock different things. Some people might not like this and would prefer everything unlocked from the start but this does give you more incentive to play. There's also local multiplayer (which I haven't tried) and online which runs very well. This game is about 3 years old and people are still playing. I'm managing to get into full lobbies. In regards to the port job, this is a port of the 360 version as always but with graphics options and it also runs really well. Some would say this is the best way to play it (much like Gens PC)The only complaints I have are this game did not want to recognise my XB1 controller until I reinstalled the game (you can also use a program called x360ce but it's incredibly fiddly) which is weird as it worked the first time with the controller and again, I personally can't care for many of the characters (The only ones I like are Sonic characters, JSR characters and BD Joe from Crazy Taxi) but that's entirely subjective.If you want a solid, fun kart racer and have no intention of buying a Nintendo console or dusting off a PS1 for CTR, this is easily a great alternative and in some cases, a better one.

content:
Posted: January 1, 2014
												[h] Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed: Surprisingly Good [/h]Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed (hereafter referred to as Sonic Racing), is a very weel designed kart racing game. It takes aspects from games like Mario Kart and improves on them, and is arguably better than Mario Kart. Althoug it's not a perfect port, it is still a nice game.Pros:-One of few kart racers for PC, with splitscreen-Racing is smooth and well-designed-A whole bunch of characters from all over the place-Plays moderatly well with a keyboard-Plays great with controllerCons:-Some issues with the port (lag during loadtimes, took some tweaking to get it working on a tv)-Connecting additional controllers took a bit of workAll in all, I think Sonic Racing is a fun party game to throw on if you have some controllers and some friends.9/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 23
												When it comes to kart racers, this game is among the best. In a time where 4-player local multiplayer games are few and far between (especially on PC), this game really is a stand-out. If you're a fan of Mario Kart or Diddy Kong Racing, you will love this game.Pros:-Controls are fluid and responsive, and landing the perfect drift feels very satisfying.-Graphics are very nice, though not spectacular. Tracks, characters and vehicles are colourful and vibrant.-Great variety when it comes to tracks, characters and gameplay modes. 100% completion will keep you busy for days.-4-player splitscreen, with the game allowing for the use of nearly any USB controller (we even use N64 controllers)!Cons:-Some races are VERY hard on higher difficulty, to the point of feeling cheap. Pretty sure the bots cheat.-No option to disable bots or items in any mode, despite the first game in the series having these options.-Occasional weird collision physics with terrain in some tracks.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 26, 2016
												This game deserve a few minutes of reviewing. First of all I'm not a big console fan and I prefer simulation racing game to arcade ones. I enjoyed Mario Kart on the SNES back in the days but the further iterations were just "meh" to me because I haven't felt any great improvement over the years. I bought this kart racing game on sale to increase my Steam library and to have a casual game to play with some friends online. I'd never tough I'd get hooked like this. It actually beats Mario Kart in every aspect thanks to it's diversity, freshness and style. The artwork quality is outstanding compared to other arcade PC games and I run at a constant 60fps on a low-midrange card with everything maxed out; it's that well optimized. The gameplay is fast, responsive and the tracks are very diversified. The levels are all themes of different Sega games in history from Sega Master System up to Dreamcast along with some brilliant remastered music. The world tour mode will encourage you in many different competition to unlock every characters and the multiplayer online, or offline up to 4, will keep you playing this little arcade gem for a while.. and come back to it from time to time because there is nothing else like it on PC. If you see this on sale, you have no excuses to overlook it. Thank you Sumo Digital & Sega for the best arcade game I played until now

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 16, 2016
												I gave this game an unfair shake when I first played it as I thought it controlled weird and I didn't care for a fair amount of the characters and the ones I do care about didn't make the cut (Ristar, Streets of Rage characters, Alien Storm characters etc) but I went back again recently and I apologise for dismissing it so quickly.This game is really damn good, better than some Mario Karts I would say. It has more than enough to hold you over regarding single player content. There's your typical grand prix cups and single races but you also have an "adventure" mode where you do different challenges to unlock different things. Some people might not like this and would prefer everything unlocked from the start but this does give you more incentive to play. There's also local multiplayer (which I haven't tried) and online which runs very well. This game is about 3 years old and people are still playing. I'm managing to get into full lobbies. In regards to the port job, this is a port of the 360 version as always but with graphics options and it also runs really well. Some would say this is the best way to play it (much like Gens PC)The only complaints I have are this game did not want to recognise my XB1 controller until I reinstalled the game (you can also use a program called x360ce but it's incredibly fiddly) which is weird as it worked the first time with the controller and again, I personally can't care for many of the characters (The only ones I like are Sonic characters, JSR characters and BD Joe from Crazy Taxi) but that's entirely subjective.If you want a solid, fun kart racer and have no intention of buying a Nintendo console or dusting off a PS1 for CTR, this is easily a great alternative and in some cases, a better one.

content:
Posted: January 26, 2016
												I originally had about 56 hours on the Xbox 360 version, so ignore the low hours on Steam:Pros:* Wide array of characters (including Wreck-It Ralph and Pyro/Heavy/Spy)* Runs well on lower end machines (around 40FPS on my Intel HD laptop)* Flawless controller support (recognized my Xbox One controller right off the bat and no issues with it)* Every mode is utilized to unlock characters * More characters than the Xbox 360 version* Addictive online mode * No cheaters/hackers online * Colorful graphics Cons:* In my honest opinion, this game is better with a controller. Maybe it's because of my 56 hours on the 360 I'm more used to it, but I feel the default mapped controls are awkward. * Game can be annoying when searching for an online match, IE you get thrashed in a lobby, so you want to find a new one, game puts you in the exact same lobby you were in before. * Not a true con in itself, but the tracks are supposed to be based off locations found in that game's universe. However, I only recognized Sonic's, Jet Set Radio's and The House of the Dead's track. The others I had no idea what they were from.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 2, 2013
												At first I figured this would just be a bleh Mario Kart Clone, but after playing it for the last few days with friends, I've honestly come to the decision that it is arguably better than Mario Kart.Mario Kart loves to give the lower-placed players better items to 'equalize', including that oft-despised Blue Shell.  In this, the "Blue Shell" analogue is a swarm of bees.  The bees however do NOT guaranteed knock up the first place person.  They can dodge it if they pay attention/slow down, making it be less of a guaranteed "HAHA GO TO SECOND PLACE"  This single change on its own is a great improvement over Mario Kart.The stages are just about at the right length to be fun, not long enough to drag on (I've yet to run into any Rainbow Road race that takes 20+ minutes and is just soul-crushingly bland once the prettiness factor wears off).  Changing vehicles definitely makes it fun as they all handle differently.  For folks who don't care about weapon powerups, there is Boost Mode, where all powerups are just boosts.  No shooting other players, just rely on your own skill.The racers seem to be decently different, but there are ways to modify them after playing as them long enough to shift their stats a bit, so if someone takes your precious Sonic, you can take another character and mod their vehicle up to have equivalent stats to Sonic's, given enough time with that char.Overall, if you grew up with a Sega and love arcade-style racing games, give this a try.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 25, 2015
												Kind of impossible to not compare this to Mario Kart.Once you get past the questions "Why the hell is sonic in a car?", then you'll start having a great time.The rubber banding is almost no where to be seen, which is nice, I feel like I'm really owning some stages.The tracks are well designed and creative which helps to make the game feel fresh every time I want to have another 30 minute session. The local multiplayer is a god send, whenver I have a couple of friends over, we race it out to this fun game. The voice over (the guy who says "Get ready! Go!") can get a little too chatty sometimes which leads to small annoyances. The items system is similar to the Mario kart item system, however, it does have some different styles, such as a blowfish, ice attacks, and drones that follow the person in front of you.The delightful Car-Boat-Plane system reminds of Diddy Kong Racing, and the flying parts have some truly beautiful set pieces to race on.It's a great game, a worthy contender to the Mario Kart franchise. 8/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 4, 2014
												This is mario kart on crack. If your a fan of "kart racers" or arcade racer, whatever the proper term/s is/are, games like mario kart, diddy kong racing or crash team racing, you'll more than likely love this. This game consists of a few types of movement; driving boating and flying. The majority of courses use 2 or all 3.The World tour mode is pretty nice. Its a combination of traditional single course races as well as different challenges such as drift and boost challences or boost races. Continuing on the single player aspect, you've still got the standard grand prix and time attack modes. Matchmaking is nice, and I personally haven't had many issues.This game also has a large amount of characters to chose from. You start with a few and unlock the rest in world tour. Each of the characters also has a few mods to change their attributes like speed and handeling. You unlock most of these by leveling up that character, and you get experience by playing as them in just about everything. The final mod, called console mods, are unlocked in world tour.The only problem I have is that the AI can be quite a challence; they seem to have a slight bias against the player. Its not impssible to beat them, but until you truly master this game and can drift-boost every single turn and never crash, they will pose a challenge on the A and S class.This game boasts the enjoyably hectic racing with pickup attacks and powers and fast-paced racing.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 8, 2013
												  If you like kart racers or fast paced arcade style racing games then this game is for you. In the golden days of quarters and pocket lint kids of all shapes, sizes and attitudes flocked to these ridiculous plastic racing chairs and dueled eachother in virtual races throwing all kinds of ridiculous objects at eachother. Easily the most memorable of these games is Mario Kart, yet this game does something that Mario Kart never did in all of its running. I enjoyed Mario Kart Wii, I loved Mario Kart 64. Yet in comparison to this game, it just doesn't hold a candle to it. This game tests your skill to quickly adapt, the tracks changes dramatically, giving new choke points and challenges to cut off and blast racers from multiple angles. This game practices a lot of the same things Mario Kart has, because its not broke so there's nothing to fix, but they adapt these things into the changes of the tracks flawlessly and it all feels perfect. I'm not the biggest fan of SEGA, except for a few of the non-sonic Dreamcast games. Yet, this game has a charm to it, that may very well make me like Sonic and all other SEGA icons.As a deathly loyal person to Nintendo (may not buy everything they make, but I do trust them as the last legitimate console makers in the world) This game has taken me over Mario Kart, and that says something.

content:
Posted: December 10, 2013
												I was never into kart racing games. Even Mario Kart bored me a bit. Maybe I'm just biased against Mario, but this is a lot of fun. The car Transformations are fun, and the animations for them are neat to watch. Sadly, I noticed that a car often controls differently in it's various transformations, so a character that controlled well on the road suddenly feels more difficult to control as a boat or plane. Leveling your character by racing and gaining experience to unlock mods is another interesting feature I can't recall seeing in Mario Kart, and it's good for when your favorite character is lacking in their speed or handeling.The game certainly doesn't disappoint when it comes to aesthetics, either. The lighting and track designs are gorgeous,  and the vehicle designs are diverse in all of their forms.One that bothers me though, is the PC exclusive characters, especially TF2 and General Winter. Who thought these were good additions for a game like this? General Winter in particular just...doesn't fit in, visually.Speaking of not fitting in, Shadow is extremely out of character and it's kind of disturbing.

content:
Posted: December 10, 2013
												I was never into kart racing games. Even Mario Kart bored me a bit. Maybe I'm just biased against Mario, but this is a lot of fun. The car Transformations are fun, and the animations for them are neat to watch. Sadly, I noticed that a car often controls differently in it's various transformations, so a character that controlled well on the road suddenly feels more difficult to control as a boat or plane. Leveling your character by racing and gaining experience to unlock mods is another interesting feature I can't recall seeing in Mario Kart, and it's good for when your favorite character is lacking in their speed or handeling.The game certainly doesn't disappoint when it comes to aesthetics, either. The lighting and track designs are gorgeous,  and the vehicle designs are diverse in all of their forms.One that bothers me though, is the PC exclusive characters, especially TF2 and General Winter. Who thought these were good additions for a game like this? General Winter in particular just...doesn't fit in, visually.Speaking of not fitting in, Shadow is extremely out of character and it's kind of disturbing.

content:
Posted: December 4, 2013
												As rather the opposite of a Sonic fan, I figured I'd try this game's predecessor, "Sonic and SEGA All-Stars Racing", and to my surprise it was a lot of fun.  It had a lot of similarities to the Mario Kart franchise, but it tweaked the things that didn't work and made it its own game, and I loved it.This game improves upon its previous iteration tremendously.  The execution of the vehicle transitions doesn't seem forced at all, and that along with the tracks actually changing and evolving during the course of each race makes each match an adventure that lasts just a few minutes.The weapons have changed greatly and no longer feel overly similar to standard Mario Kart fare.  Nearly everything is fresh and interesting, and the only guaranteed screw-yous have to be intentionally set up rather than simply fired.The controls are great, the online multiplayer works very well, and the characters are different enough to be easily recognizable at a glance.  Even the heads-up display is great.The only complaints that I have are that it's very graphically intensive, meaning that you'll likely have to drop your resolution a lot if you're running a fairly old video card; the announcer's trackside chatter is now practically gone; and new characters can only be unlocked in World Tour mode, rather than by simply playing the game and spending the resulting points.So yeah, while I do still rather dislike Sonic, I highly recommend this game for everyone who likes mascot racers.  It's a good deal at regular price, but if it ever goes on sale, JUMP ON THIS.  You won't regret it.

content:
Posted: November 30, 2013
												All-Stars Transformed is one of those games that seems like it's too gimmicky to be good...but it isn't. Where it accelerates past  other Racing games is in the design and the careful thought put into making this game the perfect spiritual successor to "Diddy Kong Racing". When you race, you travel across vast tracks of re-imagined games of Sega's history, dating all the way back to the Mega Drive and early arcade titles of the mid-late 80s. Whether you are familiar with what this title draws upon or not is irrelevant, because driving through such stunning levels compels you to check out the games that they are based on. It's a memorable experience that binds the Sega Legacy together, wrapped with a Sonic bow.If you liked the first, or if you're interested in something a little different, get this game. Best part for fans of the previous title: The annoying announcer is no longer in this game!

content:
Posted: November 16, 2015
ReviewSonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed is the new and improved follow up game to Sonic & SEGA All-Stars Racing. Transformed introduces online multiplayer, albeit a fairly buggy connection at times, a mode where you can play with friends in traditional racing or arena matches. Local split-screen mulitplayer is also an option for those that are interested.It's hard not to compare this game to Mario Kart, and Transformed is as close to Mario Kart as you can get on Steam (since you won't see any Nintendo games here). Transformed has the traditional Grand Prix, World Tour and Time Attack modes we are all accustomed with. Familiar item pickups are also present, including a sort of "Ultimate" move for each character. The animation, graphics, art style, gameplay and optimization are all extremely well done. and there isn't really a weak point to be found in this game.The karts are fairly customizable, and the driving mechanics are very fluid and polished. Drifting is smooth, allowing for extremely precise maneuverability. Transformed also employs water and air kart transformations in each level, changing up the style of the race, much like the newer Mario Karts. With so much similarity, it's hard not to like the game, assuming you liked Mario Kart at all. ScoreSonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed is truly THE kart racer to get on Steam.Masterpiece- 10/10

content:
Posted: June 27, 2016
												A friend of mine suggested this game, I was dismissive at first of course, it's Sonic, it's a kids franchise. But having read other reviews and watched some gameplay videos (and also being 50% in the Summer Sale) we went in on the 4 pack and got it for a very cheap price (also bagging the Outrun DLC). All I can say is, what a superb, fun game. A mixture of Mario Kart and Diddy Kong Racing with a few other elements thrown in. Great graphics, well optimized engine (locked at 60fps), up to 10 players in online multiplayer. I don't think I've laughed and grinned so much since I played Super Mario Kart of the SNES back in the day and it brought me back to the days when I actually enjoyed playing for once. Highly recommended.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 25, 2014
												Perhaps one of the best overall racing games that I've ever played, Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed is easily the best kart racing game that I've ever played. Mario Kart is commonly seen as the 'best' for this genre, but where as Mario Kart lets even the unskilled players win with last-place-powerups they get, Transformed instead still gives it's best powerups most commonly to the slowest racers, but makes them able to be dodged by the most skilled players. No Blue Shell stupidity here. The tracks are all fun to race around, and the transforming vehicles turn this from 'just a great racing game' to 'one of the best'.  The car, boat, and jet all control radically different, and are all fun. The tracks 'transform' as well, most of them changing every lap to accomidate more the whole 'transforming vehicles' thing. Every music track is a joy, wonderful remixes of classic Sega themes, and the tracks themselves follow a broad stretch of Sega franchises. Except Phantasy Star, ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥it, Sega.The online play is probably the best part, as the netcode works perfectly fine, and, last I tried, there was a pretty healthy community of players.  It's extremely unfortunate how many people avoid playing this gem simply because "I don't like Sonic." Anyone who even slightly likes this genre should love this game.
