content:
Posted: July 15, 2016
												okay okay... let's start shall we?!First and foremost,lemme warn you: it looks,and it feels like Mario Kart in some aspects, but it is NOT Mario Kart, so if you were looking for a game of luck(and why should you? i may ask)... look somewhere else...This game Rewards Skill over Item usage, and i must say it is a whole much better and different beast for it. you need to know when to drift,where to drift, and pratice. it is easy to go for a small casual playtrough, but hard to master, and i mean it.so, yes, you need to keep your eyes on the road at all times, a thing that i was missiing from today's karting genre... they were predictable at beast, and you could do any turn without releasing the throtle, in this game... you need to brake... (ooooh) and Drift when necessary... and oh boy this game rewards Drift... a LOT.The Cars act like cars instead of Karts, so you gotta keep that in mind... The planes act like planes, and this can trow people off, but for me, that play jet fighter games, is a nice adiction, and boats... well... act like boats, and you can trick on the waves for a little boost on speed if you're good enough... but water drift... for me... is kinda butterish, if you know what i mean...So... with this said...-Pros:-20 Sega characters from lots of games... a great game if you are a Sega Fan...  (i miss Alis from Phantasy Star,but this is just me...)-The vehicles look like vehicles and they are Badass in design, especially the Ryo's Ferrari like car, and of course the Speed star (Sonic's Vehicle)... the ones that look like cars become kinda cartoonish when they transform,but meh... i like the car froms... what can i say... the Planes... i personally like the MIG-21 like fighter jet from the special Team Fortress team...- The tracks are creative and they demand you learn braking points,drifting points, and every corner. it is great for a racing fan like me, that rage like hell, when some games adopt some ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t mechanic of "not releasing the throtle", so no casual fans... you won't be with your foot stuck on the gas at all times... and this is a better game for it.-An extensive carrer mode,and a painless casual playtrough... for the hardcore fans like me... it can turn into a nightmare goin' for 100%... but well... i cannot complain since i asked for it...-Fun grand prix modes and a very competitive online mode... i was surprised to see the online competition was fiercer than ever...-The car acts like a Car, so no shady mechanics of drift boost while stopped or all that jazz of Mario Kart(Sorry Funky Kong and all the players that love him, but for the love of god, that technique of Stand still drift is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥T in my opnion), if you hit something, you will need to accelerate to the max speed again. so this game rewards skill over item usage.-Skill over item usage. this is not a game where you will spam blue shells up and down and all arround, and might i remind you that this mechanic of Mario Kart is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥T and what kills that game for me. here, all items serve a propouse and excluding the super star moves that are not harmfull to the first place unless you are fighting for it when you get it (hard,but happens), all are balanced,and needs strategic thinking to use. heck... even the super-star moves aren't game braking, or field equalizers, so yes... you need to have skill to come in first.-Easy to get into. hard to master.Cons:-Boat mechanics are kinda iffy and water drifts are butterish... i don't like it... but this is me...-5 or 6 DLC thingys and tracks... for a game like this i think it should come as unlockables... because well... if i wanna get my friends over to play with me, i want everything on the game so they can enjoy it too... but i digress-the carrer mode is... "too long"... but it is a minor nitpick of mine... again... this is a thing that i asked for... so i digress...-Announcer is  annoying... (and yes i muted him off... sue me... i guess he is homeless now because of *SPOILERS* but i digress)Final Veredict: 8.5/10i had a good time,and the game is fun, with a lot of content. but still, if had potential to be more, so i kinda wished SEGA worked it to its full potential. it had potential to be a 10/10... but the DLC pratice for this kinda of game i cannot accept. and the Boat Butterish mechanics is what kills some water based tracks for me,but it is only me...

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 6, 2013
												A very nice animated racing game for those who always liked the genre, great tracks, great music, and a nice crew of characters to pick from.The gamplay is easy to pick up for its simplicity, but as you go on playing, you discover there are some tricks to improve the general driving, like doing pirouettes on the air to boost up, finding shortcuts on the tracks, and mastering the items to attack other characters, and for those who seek a challenge, the time trials against developers' "ghosts" are really hard to complete. There's also an online mode where you can play with strangers or with friends, unfortunately, time has rendered online lobbies kinda lonely, and you'll find yourself waiting more than what you are willing to for a race that lasts barely a couple minutes, there's also local mode if you have several controllers.For those long time fans of SEGA, there are many references to previus titles, like Jet Set Radio, Space Channel 5, Wreck-it Ralph (oddly enough) and more; so it doesn't feel like just a re branding of a generic racing game, but as a part of the world this company has created over the years.The music is nice, upbeat and suits the levels, there's an anouncer with a very loud and over the top acting who will inform of the events during the races, it can be turned off for those who find it annoying, and each character has an unique song for their All Stars power, which makes it more enjoyable when you get to do it, and very frightening when you hear another player getting it.Overall, this is a very nice game to play either with friends or alone, it offers casual fun and big challenge as you progress, a perfect gift for a young kid and a completely non-shaming acquisition for a hardcore gamer fan of the genre

At that price, this game is a must-have!★★★★☆4/5 Stars

content:

												The two Sonic & All-Star Racing games are super solid Kart racers; polished and filled with so many secrets and variety.  They by far exceed Mario Kart Wii in both presentation and overall multiplayer fun.  The many different Sega characters and properties add a crazy blend to game worlds; from realistic-esque BD Joe, to over cartoony Alex Kidd.  Yeah, the majority of the roster is B Grade, One-Shot, Sega characters, but to say the least, it just makes them that much more distinct.  The Career Mode in Transformed is Co-Op and the many missions it offers (along with the rewards) wants you to keep playing.   Also, the PC Split-Screen is VERY WELCOME!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 13, 2014
												This is potentially the best kart racer ever made. It's a beautiful, fun and fast-paced game with great music, great characters, excellent race tracks and a unique gameplay concept. This is not just like any other kart racer, in this game you race with cars that turn into boats and airplanes in the middle of the race. These transformations are seamless and intuitive. All the vehicle types have their own unique handling, but at the same time feel similar enough to each other that it doesn't cause any disorientation. No matter which form you're driving, all the vehicles control perfectly. Rather unlike the luck-based whimsy of Mario Kart, the game is highly rewarding to skilled players; many of the items can be used strategically to attack or defend yourself from opponents' attacks, and there are even ways to evade attacks with homing items when one is unarmed. Snaking is not a terribly useful tactic in this game as it's very difficult to link multiple drifts across a straight. The game is more centered around thoughtful planning of boost charging and risk management.There is a huge variety of game modes and lots of single player content to enjoy. You can go through the World Tour to unlock new characters and tracks, or play through the Grand Prix for a more streamlined experience. There are also multiplayer battle arenas with their own modes such as deathmatch, king of the hill or capture the flag (or "capture the chao" in this case). The gameplay holds true to Sonic's namesake as the vehicles move quite fast and the PC version moves along at a perfectly smooth 60 FPS, although it can reach even higher framerates at times.There is a TON of Sega fanservice in this game, and you can telll the people who made this are really passionate about Sega's history. The characters and tracks are pulled from a large variety of Sega's franchises (such as Sonic, Super Monkey Ball, Space Channel 5, Crazy Taxi, NiGHTs, Jet Set Radio, Golden Axe and even Skies of Arcadia). On top of that there are many interesting guest characters in the game, such as Wreck-It Ralph from the Disney movie of the same name, and Danica Patrick, whom Sega is sponsoring in NASCAR. Not only that but the PC version gets several exclusive characters such as General Winter from Company of Heroes II, the Shogun from Total War: Shogun, Willemus from Total War: Rome II, and the Team Fortress 2 guys. More DLC characters are on the way as well, as Ryo Hazuki from Shenmue is already available to purchase from the store. If you fancy yourself a fan of racing games, or just fun lighthearted multiplayer games in general, you will do yourself a great favor by picking this up.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 18, 2014
												After having accumulated 10 hours of gameplay on this wonderful take on Arcade racing, I can safely say that it's done everything right! I never played the original S&AAR, but while this may seem like an expansion for it, it has an innovative mechanic: the ability to drive (or fly) on land, sea and air, sometimes all in one race! To start, there are several Characters, namely ones like Sonic, but others too, like Joe Musashi from Shinobi. They all have different stats, and are best suited to personal preference. There are many you can unlock too! They all have unique sounds and quotes, and some of their cars are insanely awesome to look at!It has 4 levels of difficulty, the last being unlockable, and after you learn how to play efficently without crashing into walls or falling off, it does seem rather easy, even on hard. Expert is a real challenge, the AI can keep up with you in rather tense races. The track design is inspired by levels from various SEGA games (hence the 'All star), and they are very original ideas, with each lap (normally of 3 laps) changing the track itself! You can find yourself on a simple land track at first, but all of a sudden: the track retracts and you're on water! The actual transformations happen rather fast, but still cool.The single player consists of a 'Single race', which is 3 laps and not tournament based. Career, which sees you progress by earning stars and going through a path of races. That being said, the game offers many varients of racing, such as traffic challenges, drift challenges, Versus and more! The Career is a bit shortwinded, however. Of course, 100%-ing it will take a lot longer than I have played, but to get to the end itself doesn't take all that long. The idea is to progess through the different Cups, and you unlock characters on the way.For the cars (planes, boats etc), you can alter their attributes by levelling characters through an XP based system. You will unlock 'mods' for the Vehicles, which can, for example, improve Handling, but at a cost of speed. This is useful depending on what type of race/track you're on.The online seems to be dead, through no fault of the games, but no-one seems to play it, which is a huge shame as there is an Arena mode! That said, if you have family/friends, get them a controller (or keyboard if you're feeling like that) and play together! A controller is definetly superior for this game, more precise speed/accelaration and handling. I use a keyboard, and fortuneatly, you can rebind. You don't need the mouse for this which is cool.Finally, the Graphics in the game (at max) are beautiful! For some reason, my game locks itself at 55fps despite V-Sync being off. It is well optimised and a smooth experience and you don't need a monster PC to run it, not at all! Loading times are good, the menu and in game interface are well designed and easy to use.I think I covered everything, please comment if I left something out. Overall, 9.5/10!

content:
Posted: July 9, 2016
												This is Sega at their best. I was already a fan of the first one (played on the Xbox 360) and they made great additions in this "Transformed" version. I totally imagine this game being launched at the Dreamcast era.This is as good as any kart game can get: good old arcade gameplay with weapons and over the top races, local multiplayer to up 4 players and colorful graphics. If you're playing alone, you can try to unlock tracks and racers to your next game party. The Death Egg + Metal Sonic DLC moved to this sequel and the package is solid: various racers, a lot of tracks and all the traditional modes. I got goosebumps with the After Burner and Golden Axe tracks. The good part of all this is the PC requirements: my laptop with the GTX 740m 2GB runs the game at 60fps (and the loads are minimal in my desktop).Why there is no sequel to this is beyond me. I loved Sega at the 1980's and 1990's and there are still plenty of franchises to cover, like Altered Beast, Space Harrier, Fantasy Zone, Vectorman, Comix Zone and even OutRun. And they could ask to include characters from other franchises that made success at the Genesis era. Could you imagine Toejam & Earl as playable racers? You could take my money already, Sega.Edit 11th July 2016: there is actually an OutRun Bay stage and Space Harrier is present in the Race of AGES stage in form of music and hologram reference. So, there you have it, a complete package for Sega fans.

content:
Posted: January 2
Product received for free
												Hello, everyone. Welcome to my review for Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed. Here, I will be reviewing each seperate part. Lets start with the World Tour mode.The World Tour mode is essentially a line of 10 (except for Sunshine Coast) races, with two characters (again, except for Sunshine Coast). You earn stars based on what mode you do and if you complete the challenge, and to unlock every character, you have to earn these stars. Doing it on Easy gives you one star, doing it on Medium gives you two, doing it on Hard gives you three, and doing it on Expert gives you four. This is how you unlock most of the characters, except for one... Lets talk about that.The Grand Prix mode is 5 cups, containing the game's 20 (21 if you buy Metal Sonic & Outrun Bay) races. The cups are in this order: Dragon Cup, Rogue Cup, Emerald Cup, Arcade Cup, and Classic Cup. But wait, theres more.  If you finish each cup, you can unlock the mirrored versions of each cup. Finishing these unlocks you Dr. Eggman. So, lets talk about the cast.You have Sonic & his friends, AiAi and MeeMee, Beat, and plenty more. Want to be a part of the past? Choose AGES. Want a unique car? Wreck-It Ralph has you covered. Do you even want to play unarguably the most annoying character?! That would be the Yogscast! (even if I don't find him annoying, just good stats and annoy others that find him annoying even though you can play NiGHTS with the EXACT SAME STATS BUT BEARABLE TO LISTEN TO! Gee, its almost as if they dont WANT you to spend extra money on their game... oh wait, Metal Sonic and Ryo.)Now, we should talk about multiplayer.Multiplayer is really good, actually. You can play with any character you have, even if you cant get back in first if you get hit by... anything, really. Its fun.Overall, I give S&ASRT a 'Yogscast has been eliminated!'/ten.

We may never get the answer to why sonic needs a race car, it's obvious why he needs a boat and a jet.  Buckle up and put the pedal to the medal in this high speed kart racer that hits the seas and takes to the sky.At the core it's the same formula of 'Mario Kart' dressed up with sega (and friends) characters and tracks.  Turns out the formula still works and creates a great looking racer that also plays well.

content:
Posted: January 22, 2016
												It's like Mario kart, but more or less everything is done really well... which is exactly unlike Mario Kart. There's no idiotic bias for weapons based on your position, and it is a largely skill based ordeal.The AI can be a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥♥on harder difficulties, so if you get upset easily, but want to be a completionist (or at least unlock everything)  you might want to be wary. For 20€ it's more or less a steal, and anything below that it's a no brainer, which is something i don't say lightly. It also isn't just simply racing. There's some twists thrown in at times in the fashion of challenge maps of drifting, flying and time attack (solo) variety.The only gripe i have with the game is mild randomness in jumping physics in certain maps, especially in boats. If you just get bad waves off something, you can't consistently do flips/drifting to keep up your speed, which probably lost me a couple of races, but it's a small thing to moan about.Average playtime along everyone on friendslist: 22.5 hours.Average playtime along everyone on friendslist with the highest and the lowest removed: 21.1 hours.

The air/land/water vehicle transformation gimmick works out nicely, as your vehicle controls rather differently in each form, and the game includes kart-racer staples such as boosts for extended drifting or doing flips and rolls off of ramps (or barrel-rolling out of the way of obstacles when in plane mode)There are no lightning bolts or blue shells to result in cheap losses in this racer, and most attack items work almost instantly; your demise is entirely determined by how well the other guy aims regardless of any amount of defensive driving. On one hand, most attacks won't slow you down all THAT much, but on the other hand, regaining lost position is not as easy as most racers. If you fall to last place, count yourself lucky if you can get back up to fourth or third.Apart from the standard GP and single races, the game also features a robust "world tour" mode filled with challenges ranging from drift challenges, traffic dodging, time trials, battle races, and even boss battles against a tank.I'd definitely call this game worth trying, even if you aren't the biggest fan of Sonic and friends.

number of helpful: 2 of 6 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 8, 2013
												This is by far the best kart racer I've ever played, and blows away any version of Mario Kart. The game balance is fine-tuned: There is no best character or best car, and if you don't like the way a particular character handles at first, you can unlock alterations. There are no spoiler weapons like blue shells. The races are skill-based, there aren't any ways to skip over massive sections of track a la Mario Kart.The design is incredible, several of the levels blew me away in terms of visuals.The game scales down well if you are running an older system (playing this on a laptop I bought in 2009).The AI is challenging. On the hardest difficulty, you will only beat them on the hardest difficulty by mastering the gameplay and then mastering the track in turn.Extremely worthwhile purchase if you have any interest in kart racers.

												An exellent kart racing game.   Simple but beautiful visuals accompany some very awesome race tracks as you transform from plane to car to boat trying to beat your opponents.   There are a variety of characters to choose from each with their own transforming vehicle.   The pickups are pretty good but nothing too special.   This game can become very fun online or when playing with friends.  Split-screen can be played online which is a plus.   Controls are smooth.   One of the best, if not the best Kart racers to come along in along time.+Controls great with X360 Gamepad+Graphics are pleasing and not too demanding+Variety of characters from the SEGA to choose+Split-Screen racing for friends.-Only 1 extra track has been released.  Needs a few more.-Touching other players in online races can have odd physics related issued.-

content:
Posted: November 19, 2015
This game will kick your♥♥♥♥♥to the curb, pin you to the asphalt with its metaphorical foot, and make you cry for mercy while it sucks the life and energy out of you. But at the end of the day, it is an exhilerating and thrilling experience that I would never refund [partially because it's been well over two days since I got the game].BUT, this is only if you play the game properly. Playing singleplayer on C class is slow and boring, as the CPUs may as well be rocks rolling along the ground, vaguely trying to get to the finish line before you. B class is a decent speed, but about as challenging as singleplayer Mario Kart [in my years of playing, MK is easy even on Mirror mode, the 'hardest' difficulty].But A and S classes are where it's at. Yes, the game is hard as Metal Sonic's crotch, but one can always go to characters like Metal Sonic and Sonic himself as a crutch if needed. It's taken me weeks to beat certian missions in the World Tour mode, but when I did, I was literally speechless, and incredibly satisfied that I finally beat them. Granted, I frequently give double middle fingers to the screen when losing, and love to cuss my lungs out at CPU racers for cheap shots and such, but IT'S A RACE. Everyone's in it to win, and playing the hard and master difficulties of this game is like you're against actual other people..... generally.Personal shoutouts go to Galactic Parade and Ocean View, for being throwbacks to my favorite stage of Sonic Colors [the absolutely GORGEOUS Starlight Carnival], and the opening stage of my favorite Sonic game [Seaside Hill/Ocean Palace from Sonic Heroes], respectively. The former is a fun course to race on in general, and the latter is a massive nostalgia trip for me.However- if you ever find a player of this game that is actually good at racing on Burning Depths, assume they are an actual sociopathic obsessive of the game. That course is hell underwater.[Best played with a wired controller, I say]PS: when I said I wouldn't ever refund this game, I said so exclusively because I can't. I lost yet another of the tiny remaining shards of my self worth to this game. Don't play it.

content:
Posted: December 10, 2014
												This game is so much fun, both in singleplayer and online. It has a great catchy soundtrack taken from previous SEGA games, really gorgeous colourful graphics, the tracks are massively varied as are the characters, of which there are many to unlock. It has a lot of replayability as well thanks to the various modes and the World Tour being impressively challenging on Expert difficulty, as well as trying to level all the racers up to max.Overall a great game from SEGA, and it provides a really nice homage to previous generations of videogaming as well!I give it a 9.5/10.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful4 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 14, 2013
												Surprisingly for a "childs" game, this game is hard as ♥♥♥♥. If you're looking for a challenging Kart style game, this is definitely where this game shines over Mario Kart. It'll definitely keep you busy with all of the different modes available. The challenges sown throughout the World Tour mode really keep things interesting because not every level is a race against A.I. opponents.The challenges, in fact, almost seem like a break from the action as the A.I. in this game is unforgiving and has special properties on Hard and Expert difficulties. These special properties take on the form of having constant momentum even when struck by an item... It's actually quite a load of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t but if you can somehow manage to get by all 10 racers staying in first place is much easier to do than in Mario Kart.I'm going to say I have mixed feelings about the characters / locations, although it is Sega were talking about so the selection is rather slim. I do give them prop's for including Ristar as the flagman... They just didn't include Sparkster which I thought was blasphemous... I mean really? Team Fortress guys, Danica Patrick and that damn lame monkey from Monkey Balls but no Sparkster? ♥♥♥♥ that noise... pay Konami their royalties and get him in the game!I must say that the inclusion of Joe Musashi from Shinobi and Vyse from Skies of Arcadia made up for the games lack of awesome character variety though. Also the Sega Ages vechicle is just pimp... there's nothing more bad♥♥♥♥♥than your car morphing in to a Dreamcast controller.The leveling system is pretty cool and allows you to unlock engine mods which allows pre-set stat adjustments to the state of your character and his / her vehicle. Although I must say some characters are terribly unbalanced and even though I had some favorite characters I would have liked to use as my mains, I just couldn't find the right mod setup to make them worthwhile sinking time in to. All in all the Team Fortress guys are insanely broken and I hate Sega for having to toot Vavles horn by including them in the PC release. They basically have the most balanced mods in the game... it's just biased.One last thing to note is the incredible throw back soundtrack as well, wicked retro hit themes from: Nights, Shinobi, Golden Axe, House of the Dead, Skies of Arcadia, Sonic & Knuckles, Space Harrier and After Burner... top notch adrenaline rushing music!It's definitely worth sinking some time in to even if you play the game on Easy, it's fun for the nostalgia alone. Definitely worth my 5 dollars... would have gladly paid 20 after all the hours I sank in to it. 7 / 10 over all.

content:
Posted: May 12, 2014
												Sonic & All Stars Racing Transformed is a kart racer, which takes to air, road and water as your kart transforms to accommodate the interesting courses The game is a servicable kart racer and there is a decent selection of characters, many of which you will have to unlock, giving incentive for solo play. The racing controls are standard, although a bit sluggish in terms of reponse, with your standard drifting for boosts, arrows on the ground providing boosts and combat pickups. The allstar mode is the character's special weapon and the standard universal weapons are well balanced. The courses and the graphics are great and there are unique themes to each which are well designed and often from specific classic titles. The online multiplayer is also enjoyable although some people report connection issues with online play. Overall the game gets a full recommend as it is a reasonably priced game which will deliver lots of fun for acade racer enthusiasts.

content:
Posted: January 9, 2016
												Honestly, forgive me if im sounding like some really whiney salt in the wound but i think this game is very unfair. i do like the fast pace racing, large rooster of characters, and the really well done designs but it doesnt hold up the horrible controls and terrible mechanics. everytime i start a race, the game always tries to screw me over where ever it possibly can. im talking about crashing into nothing making me stop on a dime and having all the other racers go past me costing the race, game having a tantrum when im in all-star so it resets me back to transform circles, getting targeted all the time even though there are so many others literally right in front of thier faces, the map throws me off the map because everything hates me aparently, the game closes itself while it keeps going while i have nothing but my desktop in my face. yeah, try a whole ton of crap like that and (claps) you have yourselves a complete and utter mess. i dont hate the game... ok a little butwhat im trying to say is that its a fun game of course, but the game isnt very frendly to cooparate.

number of helpful: 2 of 7 people (29%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 18, 2016
												This game could have been great, but it is no Sonic All Star Racer. You will find your self just going head first into objects and walls. The tracks are made in a way it is very hard to tell what is coming and there are objects like spiders and barrels that you will just constantly crash into.When ever you transform into boat mode you have even less control and you will crash crash and crash.The on-line mode have people that have played for over 300 hours so you have no way of beating them since they know every inch and know when to do tricks and boosts. I just wish the other Sonic racing game was still on-line because it was more balanced had better tracks music and weapons. None of the weapons stand out and "going all star" can be the death of you. There are tracks that are so easy to fall off the sides that going all star will make you fall to your doom constantly until it wear off. (the original game had an auto pilot when you went all star) This will just make you rage quit with broken physics and bad track design. There are many moments (when in a boat or air-plain mode) that you have to squeeze through a sewer pipe or tree hole that has only just enough room for one person, you will find your self crashing into other players and then crashing into the side of it head first and it will take you 5-10 secs to slowly move back on course. The singer player has moments that are stupid. There is a level when you have to kill a giant tank (its a cool and good idea) But the tank drops green bombs that you have to avoid, but the power up's that you have to pick up are also green cubes that look like the tank bombs, it's just a mess. It is a fun game singer player for a few hours but not one that i will play much. Biggest problems are the track layouts and the physics. Some tracks have so many pits falls and tight turns with no safety rail that you will fall to your death all the time, and there is so much crap on the screen your sensors are in over load. If a car slightly touches you, you can bounce all over the place and end up in last place facing the wrong direction... When in air plain mode you are never 100% sure where you should be flying and i often found my self hitting invisible walls above me and to the sides. I know they were trying something new with the airplains and boats but every time i transform i am always wishing that they would just keep me as a car, and since you are only a car 1/3rd of the time, you will be spending most of your time in absolute misery.
